replies.body: Only 2 weeks? Does Riot want to succ off Chiefs anymore?

ONLY 2 weeks? It literally says they applied for accounts but too late, which of course is not the players responsibility. If you were a player going to bootcamp and got there without an account, I bet you would scout out an unofficial one until Riot got their shit together to give you one. This ban penalises the players for no reason
It's still account sharing, Omni got banned for a whole year for the same 'rule'.
Omni was caught boosting accounts, for at least 30 games.
Ok, Chiefs would've played at least 10-30 games on someone else's account. How is that not the same?

" While the Chiefs did apply for accounts for their bootcamp in China in October 2016, they did so within a small margin of time before travel. As a result, they were left without official accounts for the first part of their bootcamp."

How is the above Riot's fault?
Team manager or whoever was designated to request Riot for temporary accounts, is at fault here,
Players are also responsible because they knew what they were getting themselves into, and yet used those accounts to practice.

Of course, it would be a different story if players were told the accounts were officially provided by Riot.

They are lucky to get away with the penalties.

i guess riot get away with poor and lackluster support yet again.
